oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Print "Columbia gives her son the accolade of the new chivalry of humanity"
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This patriotic print, designed by E. H. Blassfield in 1919, was given to the relatives of Pvt. Charles Blair, Co. E, 125th Inf. Regt., 32nd Div. World War, 1914-1918. Charles (Charley) was the brother of John Blair (see GWnash037 and GWnash038). The 32nd Div. spent part of the war attached to the French Army and as such Blair saw action at Juvigny, Soissons, and Verdun. Later, as part of the U.S. Third Army, they fought in the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. Blair was kiiled in action on October 9, 1918.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
